posts.content:
This front seat set came out of my US 67 import and they are in excellent condition. The covers are a dark green fabric which may be a replacement material, as it had some restoration work done in the US back in the 80's, so I'm guessing they were put one then. But they have a real period feel to them.
The only reason I'm selling them is that the bulkhead had been hacked about and I came across a walkthrough cut, so it was an opportunity to go down that route.

These are ready to drop straight in, I'm not sure quite what these are worth, but I'm open to decent offers, but let's start at £750 for the set.
Cheers Kevin Mobile: 07752 107235

IMG_6993.JPG
IMG_6994.JPG
These seats may be from a LHD but they also fit RHD post 63 buses...

Hi mate for reference and without seeing the actuall condition the seats are worth
£500+

The offer of 250 is a ....... take

Steve

silversteve wrote:Hi mate for reference and without seeing the actuall condition the seats are worth
£500+

The offer of 250 is a ....... take

Steve


lol

I have had a fruitless search in the UK for a late OG 1/3 drivers seat over the past year or so at a reasonable price.

Based on my experience something like 275-300 pound would be a minimum starting point I would expect to be paying for a complete bare drivers seat frame alone (with springing) never mind one with period look covering and piped trim garnish.

Please correct me if anyone’s firsthand experience of trying to gain possession of these is different to my own but there just does not seem to be many around.

Cheers for the info guys, it's a difficult one pricing something like these, I had to pay a small fortune for a set of Walkthrough seats, which I know are harder to get, these seats are ready to drop straight in and I'm just trying to recoup some money needed to buy more bits for my bus! Thanks
Yes sorry they're sold on the weekend
